Have you lost your job due to COVID-19?


Here's some advice on how to handle your job search:

Apply for jobs, but ensure you tailor your resume for each application, based on the job description and don't just send the same resume to anyone and everyone hoping for a positive reply.

A normal resume is not going to cut it anymore. Screenings will take place at the resume stage itself and you may not be called for a video interview. You need to stand out from the competition. To do this, personalize your resume for every company that you apply to.

One piece of advice I have found helpful from a professor of mine, is to scrap out unnecessary sections from your resume and instead focus on the following details -

-What does the organization do?

-Your capabilities, talents and skills

-How does it fit in with the mission of the company?

-How can you create a revenue source for the company?

In times like these, companies would want to focus on their revenue and profits so that they can stay afloat, and every addition to their headcount will have to be justified.
